sub_topic: Probability of winning a game of chance
message_1: A game involves rolling a fair six-sided die. What is the probability of rolling a 4 or a 6 on a single roll of the die?
message_2:
The probability of rolling a 4 or a 6 on a single roll of a fair six-sided die can be calculated by finding the number of successful outcomes (rolling a 4 or a 6) and dividing it by the total number of possible outcomes (rolling any number from 1 to 6).

There are 2 successful outcomes (rolling a 4 or a 6) and 6 possible outcomes (rolling any number from 1 to 6).

So, the probability of rolling a 4 or a 6 is:

P(4 or 6) = (Number of successful outcomes) / (Total number of possible outcomes) = 2/6 = 1/3

Therefore, the probability of rolling a 4 or a 6 on a single roll of a fair six-sided die is 1/3 or approximately 0.3333.
